xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 08 August 2013
xwikidoc.content: <Jim_> has joined #medsavant 02:09 <Jim_> has joined #medsavant 02:09 <Jim_> Hi Sergiu? 02:30 <sdumitriu> Hi Jim_ 02:30 <Jim_> hi 02:31 <Jim_> So I've made changes to Savant and MedSavant, and for MedSavant to compile it needs to be able to see the Savant changes 02:31 <sdumitriu> Hold on, granting you access 02:32 <sdumitriu> Try now 02:33 <Jim_> it says rejected 02:33 <Jim_> oh maybe i need to pull first 02:33 <sdumitriu> pull 02:33 <Jim_> ok, worked 02:34 <Jim_> now how does it work with the pom in medsavant? is the repository synchronized with github? 02:34 <sdumitriu> Well, medsavant depends on savant-2.0-SNAPSHOT 02:35 <sdumitriu> Which it can find either locally on your computer, if you built it, or in our Nexus repository 02:35 <sdumitriu> Nexus gets populated by Jenkins 02:35 <Jim_> right, i had it setup in a local repository 02:35 <sdumitriu> Jenkins builds whenever there's a commit on GitHub 02:35 <Jim_> oh ok 02:36 <Jim_> so it's nicely automated 02:36 <sdumitriu> So, it should work for everybody after about 5 minutes 02:36 <sdumitriu> Yes 02:36 <Jim_> Excellent, thanks 02:36 <sdumitriu> Except that right now the Savant build is broken 02:36 <sdumitriu> (intentionally) 02:36 <sdumitriu> I have to patch and release a maven plugin 02:37 <sdumitriu> But the build fails after the main jar is built, so it shouldn't affect the automation process 02:37 <sdumitriu> Going to sleep 02:37 <sdumitriu> Bye 02:37 <Jim_> OK, good night, thanks 07:11 <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 08:55 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 12:05 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 13:20 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 14:38 <Jim> has joined #medsavant
